str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To reap, gather, harvest. From theros; to harvest.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
(a) pay, wages, salary, (b) reward, recompense, punishment. Apparently a primary word; pay for service, good or bad.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From sun and ago; to lead together, i.e. Collect or convene; specially, to entertain.
Probably from the base of harpazo; fruit, literally or figuratively.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To sow, spread, scatter. Probably strengthened from spao; to scatter, i.e. Sow.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To reap, gather, harvest. From theros; to harvest.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to be 'cheer'ful, i.e. Calmly happy or well-off; impersonally, especially as salutation, be well.
Together, at the same place and time. Genitive case of homos as adverb; at the same place or time.
